results.title: A Venezia
results.brief_description: Covers cultural activities during the World Week for Venice, organised by UNESCO. Appearances by Peter Ustinov, Spanish flamenco dancers Jose and Ricardo, Ravi Shankar, Paul McCartney and Wings, Georges Moustaki and many other performers are interspersed with scenes of Venice.

results.title: A Union of opposites
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this penultimate episode in the series, Philip Zimbardo looks at the discipline of psychology in terms of reconciling opposites, in the same way as the yin and yang of Eastern philosophy. These include nature and nurture, brain and mind, conditioned responses and behavioural freedom, life span development from infancy to old age, the power and the fallibility of the mind and our role as individuals and as group members. Yet in spite of all the advances in psychological knowledge this century, we can still only suggest the complexity of human nature.

results.title: A Union free seminar
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, Barrie Howells, Laura Alper and Laszlo Barna
results.brief_description: Techniques for union-proofing the workplace are presented in a concise, straightforward manner by Charles Hughes, management consultant and guru of the North American union-free movement. Excerpted from one of his popular management seminars, this film, and the information Hughes presents in it, will draw the attention of both union organizers and management.

results.title: A Typical garden spider
results.brief_description: Presents a study of the life cycle of the cross spider showing how the spider builds its web, how it traps food in the web, how the female protects her eggs, and how the young spiders hatch and emerge from cocoons. Includes scenes of a spider trapping a fly in the web, stinging it to paralyse it, and encasing it in a cocoon of silk.

results.title: A Two year old goes to hospital. - Abridged version
results.creator_credit: Tavistock Child Development Research Unit and James Robertson
results.brief_description:
The normal small child is intensely attached to his parents, especially to his mother, and if going to hospital means leaving her care he will fret - no matter how kindly he is cared for by the doctors and nurses. This film is in use throughout the world by lecturers and tutors who wish to illustrate the subtle way in which small children may show or conceal deep feelings of distress.
Abridged version of original film made in 1953 by James Robertson.

results.title: A Twelve step case
results.brief_description: An investigation of alcoholism in Victoria. Traces the gradually degenerating life of an alcoholic. Considers alcoholism as a social problem, its relationship to road accidents and crime; and the work being done at St Vincent’s Hospital, Gresswell Rehabilitation Centre and by Alcoholics Anonymous. Doctors and social workers discuss the problem. A Dateline 71 Report.

results.title: A TV guide: thinking about what we watch
results.creator_credit: George McQuilkin, Churchill Films and Larry Stein
results.brief_description: A police show, a commercial and other vignettes lead children through an investigation of the “reality” and values on television. Racial and sexual stereotypes, job depictions and easy solutions to problems, are examined.

results.title: A Trumpet for the combo
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: In a city high school, a jazz combo needs a trumpet player. Randy is the natural choice since he is the most talented, but the music teacher favors Bruce, a black student. What should come first? The band? The opportunity it affords to Bruce? The teacher’s pleasure? These are questions for the audience to decide.

results.creator_credit: David Cobham Productions, Film Producers Guild and David Cobham

results.title: A Trip to the moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Milan Herzog and William Peltz
results.brief_description: An imaginary rocket takes off to the moon and explores its surface. Describes conditions met in navigation to the moon. Once above the moon’s surface, shows in detail the craters and “seas”, the valleys and mountains that can be seen from the earth.
